newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal reaffirms 4.0 pct budget deficit in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Portugal reaffirms 4.0 pct budget deficit in 1996.

text.p: Finance Minister Antonio Sousa Franco reaffirmed on Friday that the government expects the 1996 budget deficit to be 4.0 percent of gross domestic product (GDP), below the 4.1 percent projected in the official budget programme.
He had been asked to confirm the figure after documents distributed by the Finance Ministry as part of a 1997 budget draft gave the deficit/GDP ratio for 1996 as 4.3 percent.
"The estimate at the moment is for 4.0 percent," Sousa Franco said. No explanation was immediately available for the discrepancy.
The minister is counting on higher tax revenues and a crackdown on current expenditure to drive the deficit down to 2.9 percent in 1997.
